title: Cred for upping the quality of chromas!
body:
New chromas on PBE!
http://www.surrenderat20.net/2017/03/37-pbe-update.html

They really add more than a lot of the older ones! Good job! I especially like the different balloons of Surprise Party Amumu:
https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-ion8lqqVZY8/WL8YyTbe_RI/AAAAAAAAfYo/MOJvIYLxkpUuDxUmduxFpPlaDrfooyGRQCLcB/s1600/Amumu_15.jpg

And the new faces and details for the Meowkai skin:
https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-P9Cq2zxvm9E/WL8Yzo7YZcI/AAAAAAAAfZs/EGUOzPlDsioMR_SrCrcDf4mmEOiF4-QuQCLcB/s1600/Meowkai_15.jpg

___

I'll post some suggestions while we are at it:

**Project Zed**
http://i.imgur.com/zwgI3zg.png

**Project Lucian**
http://i.imgur.com/IjdtQJI.jpg

http://i.imgur.com/q0Svkj2.png

For some skins, like Project Lucian, I think it would be more interesting with new colours for his VFX, rather than added details to the skin. You would also have the opportunity to add the armoured glove that is displayed in the splash art, but which is _not_ in-game. That is to say: I would not mind added details in addition, but if I would have to choose between the two, with the low cost in mind, I would choose VFX.

replies.body:
Thanks for the encouragement :)

Thanks to everyone’s feedback, we evolved our mindset when making chromas.  Instead of aiming to provide color change options, we now look for ways to create “skins for skins”.

Before we begin, we try our best to give each sets of chromas a sub-theme.  Instead of giving the clothing new colors, we look at the base thematic and see if we can dive deeper into the sub-themes in that alternate universe.  

My personal favorite set is the Dragon Slayers.  We asked ourselves, if the dragon slayers fought and slew different elemental dragons, what would the armor look like after they took the dragon parts and crafted armor out of them?  What would the scales look like for each elemental dragon?  An ancient earth dragon's body overgrown with moss or a powerful black dragon with magma seeping from the scales?  How would the fight have gone down?  Did they rip the wings or chip a horn in the fight?

Whenever it makes sense, we also try to hide little easter eggs in the chromas for players to find.  The onesie sets and Amumu cakes gave us some opportunity to do that.  Have fun finding them.  XD

I totally agree.
Chroma's have SO MUCH potential to be absolutely awesome.
But a lot of the time, even after the skins team decided to Revise how they do them, we ended up with some pretty mediocre results.
I was really bummed out with the Dragon Slayer Xin Zhao ones, they were just poorly done and plain. I also didn't appreciate them being on such a poor release skin.

These ones of the other hand are actually impressive, fun and unique, and despite being done a release skin, they are actually still worth it.

I hope we see this continue, and for the team to seriously push it when it comes to skins and chroma's instead of ALWAYS clinging to the classic assets like in the past. (Even recently in some cases)

I do feel Dragonslayer Xin needs some more contrasting colours on some of the chromas though, and that some of the spears are too close to each other in colour. **Obsidian** and **Sandstone** need to be further away from each other in colours overall. What I find most problematic is that the cloth at the end of the handle near the spear's head has the same colour as the armour for all versions, which looks really bad and does not make the weapon stand out enough, which could translate to visibility issues. Ruby is the worst offender here, where the skin ends up like a red blob. I really like what you are going for, you just need to improve upon it a tad more.

Now the question is can we have a skin for a skin of a skin.


We must go deeper.
